title: What is the purpose of HTML?
a: Separate the document content from its presentation,which allows web developers to control how a web page looks and feels
b: Add functionality to a web page or application, making it more dynamic and user-friendly
c: Simplify the process of adding interactivity and dynamic behavior to web pages, improving user experience and reducing development time
d: Structure the content of a web page and to define how it is displayed in a browser.

title: What is JavaScript?
a: A scripting language used for automation, web development, and other tasks
b: A high-level general-purpose programming language used for web development, scientific computing, data analysis, artificial intelligence, and more.
c: A programming language designed for platform independence and used for developing a variety of applications.
d: A scripting language used to create dynamic and interactive web pages and web applications.

title: What is CSS?
a: CSS stands for Cascade Styling Sheets, which is used to structure the content of a web page and to define how it is displayed in a browser.
b: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets, which is used to structure the content of a web page and to define how it is displayed in a browser.
c: CSS stands for Cascade Styling Sheets, which is used to style the visual appearance of a web page and separate it from its content.
d: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets, which is used to style the visual appearance of a web page and separate it from its content.
